titleStmt.title: Charles H. Phillips v. William Billings. Answer

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Charles H. Phillips v. William Billings. Answer
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Territory of Washington. County of Thurston } ss
IN THE DISTRICT COURT HOLDING TERMS AT OLYMPIA
Territory of Washington vs. Charles H. Phillips
In the matter of Charles H. Phillips Writ of Habes Corpus
The United States of America to William Billings, Sheriff and Keeper of the jail of and in Thurston County, Greeting:

We command you that you have the body of Charles H. Phillips detained in our jail under your custody, it is said, under safe and secure conduct by whatsoever name the said Charles H. Phillips may be charged before the Judge of one District Court at his Chambers at the Court house in the City of Olympia in said county, together with the casue of the detention of the said Charles H. Phillips, to and receive what one said court shall consider concerning him in this behalf; and have you then and there this writ.
Witness the Honorable John P Hoyt Judge of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory this 1st day of August 1884 R.G. O'Bruin Clerk
Territory of Washington County of Thurston } ss

I William Billings Sheriff of Thurston County Washington Territory and Keeper of the jail thereof, do hereby certify that the within writ of Habeas Corpus was served on me on the 1st day of August 1884 and in answer thereto I say that I hold the prisoner Charles H Phillips by virtue of a committment of which the following is a true copy.
United States of America Territory of Washington County of Thurston
To any Constable and the Keeper of the County Jail of said County.

Whereas at a Justice Court held at my office in said County for the trial of George Weisal and C H Phillips for the offense herein after stated the said George Weisal and C H Phillips were convicted of having on the 3rd day of July 1884 in said County committed the offense of Grand Larceny and upon conviction, the said Court did adjudge and determine that the said George Weisal and C H Phillips should be held in bonds in the sum of $300.00 each and in default shall be committed to the County Jail of said County. Wherefore you the said Constable or Sheriff are commanded in the name of the United States forthwith to convey and deliver the said George Weisal and C H Phillips to the said Keeper and you the said Keeper are hereby commanded to receive the said George Weisal and C H Phillips into your custody in said jail and there safely keep until they shall there be discharged by due course of law.
Dated this 3rd day of July 1884 W.T. Keady J.P.
Which said committment is now in my hands and I have here the said petitioner. Witness my hand at Olympia this 2nd day of August 1884
William Billings Sheriff of Thurston County and Keeper of said County Jail
By C B Harmon Deputy Sheriff's Fees Producing deft in Court on Writ $1.00 One days attendance in Court 3.00 Return on writ .40 4.40
